title.narrative: 003. COMMUNITY AND INSTITUTIONAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SU

description.narrative: Communities, schools and health centres have access to sufficient safe water in targeted rural community in the Dry Zone, conflict effected children and women in Mon and Kayin States., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Water and excreta related diseases in under-5 children are equitably reduced.

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, schools and health centres have access to sufficient safe water in targeted rural community in the Dry Zone, conflicteffected children and women in Mon and Kayin States.

description.narrative: 84,147 people (51 percent women) from 65 villages have access to basic water services through community managed water metering systems in dry zone, Rakhine and Kayin. 22,622 students (51 percent girls) in 140 schools of 15 townships in Kayin, Kachin, Kayah and Chin States have access improved WASH facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/12/2017

title.narrative: Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support

Number of villages using improved sources of drinking water in targeted townships
